title: Scalar curvature along Ebin geodesics
abstract: Let $M$ be a smooth, compact manifold and let $\mathcal{N}_μ$ denote the set of Riemannian metrics on $M$ with smooth volume density $μ$. For a given $g_0\in \mathcal{N}_μ$, we show that if $\dim(M)\ge 5$, then there exists an open and dense subset $\mathcal{Y}_{g_0} \subset T_{g_0} \mathcal{N}_μ$ (in the $C^{\infty}$ topology) so that for each $h\in \mathcal{Y}_{g_0}$, the $(\mathcal{N}_μ,L^2)$ Ebin geodesic $γ_h(t)$ with $γ_h(0)=g_0$ and $γ_h'(0)=h$ satisfies $\lim_{t \to \infty}$ $R(γ_h(t))=-\infty$, uniformly.
